title: Disney+ Review!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Today we're gonna talk about Disney+. This was actually a really wildly requested video. So many of you guys have been Tweeting me, leaving me comments asking me what are my thoughts on Disney+. Am I going to subscribe? What shows am I watching? And what do I think. And obviously I'm a huge Disney fan. It's something that so many of us grew up with and just the nostalgia factor of Disney+ alone is amazing. A huge thank you to Disney for sponsoring this video. When I first logged in to Disney+, it was just like this wave of emotions, and I saw so many shows that I had watched when I was younger. For example, one of the shows that I recently watched that was from my childhood, I remember so distinctly watching this old version of Shaggy Dog with my family, and it was weird watching it because I had the same feelings that I had when I was younger. So it was kind of bring back all of these memories. And it's so cool that Disney has such an expansive library. And it's not just Disney that you're getting access to. Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic, and so much more. It's sort of overwhelming, but in the best possible way. Disney+ is $6.99. Or if you wanna just buy the whole year, it's $69.99. I'm gonna put a link in the description where you guys can get a seven day free trial. Check it out and I just wanna know what you guys think because I have been having the best time. I've been so busy over the past few weeks and I've been traveling a lot which is great because I love watching content on flights because that's usually my time to just kind of hang out. And if I don't have any videos to edit, I'm looking for content to watch. And what's great is you can still have this stuff offline. So you can download the shows and take them on the go. Most planes do have wifi, but you definitely don't wanna rely on wifi to watch any content ever. Just be sure to download it before I go. And I'm sure many of you guys are probably traveling for the holidays. And if you're not, I'm sure there's gonna be some holiday downtime. So this could not be a more perfect time to watch a lot of content. Another thing that is really great is it's available on so many different platforms. When I was traveling back from Nashville I knew that I had about like a four and a half ish flight, and this was the day that Disney+ had launched. So in that flight, before we took off I watched the first episode of The Mandalorian. I watched Encore, I watched Lady in the Tramp. It was really cool to see, because obviously I have a dog and I love my dog more than anything. So to see these dogs interacting with each other and having real, genuine conversations and feelings. I mean I have conversations with my dog all the time, but to see that in like an updated version of Lady in the Tramp was pretty great. I also watched The Imagineering Story. - [Narrator] Walt set a standard early on with The Imagineering. - This is such a fun show that covers a bunch of amazing moments in Disney history. You get to meet a lot of incredible people who helped bring so many creative ideas to life. There's just so many great shows. Another show that I was so surprised by was Encore. I'm not really like the biggest fan of Broadway or like plays. I enjoy them, but it's not something that I go out of my way to watch. So in preparing for my review I watched the first episode and it made me almost cry. The premise of the show is a bunch of adults who kind of go back to recreate their high school plays. The first one was Annie and they did such a great job storytelling because a lot of these people obviously aren't professional actors. So they were able to pull so many great stories out of these people. Kristen Bell is one of the executive producers of the show so obviously I had to give it a shot because I'm such a huge fan of hers as well. The second episode is the Beauty in the Beast episode which was also really good. And they have all kinds of Disney movies. I mean they even have The Simpsons. Scrolling through to see some of my other favorites. They also have some cute little Pixar shorts. There's one where it's Forky from Toy Story 4, which is probably, I think, now one of my favorite movies of all time. Everything about Toy Story 4 was incredible. The story, the characters, it's just so good. Oh My Gosh, Zenon, Girl of the 21st Century. If I was able to be a Disney star at one point, I think this probably would've been me. The description is "2049 and teen Zenon "happily lives on an orbiting space station. "When her curiosity gets her in trouble "she's sent to Earth for punishment "and needs to learn how to fit in." This is amazing because I feel like I'm related so much to this show. Hannah Montana, Boy Meets World, that's so amazing! I think for how much you're paying and what you're getting this is such an amazing deal, especially for families. And the fact that you can just download it and take it on the go is really great. I also watched Turner & Hooch. I kinda was going back to all of the shows that I watched when I was younger. 1989! I was five. I just realized that I didn't even get a chance to really talk about The Mandalorian yet. I cannot believe how incredible this show is. I mean obviously it's Star Wars and I love Star Wars. I love the entire world with Star Wars. But this show, there's something so special about it. I wish that I was filming my reaction because when I got towards the end of the first episode, I just (gasps) could not believe my eyes and what I was seeing. And the best thing is I avoided all spoilers. I didn't read any reviews. I wanted to go into this knowing nothing. I didn't even watch any of the trailers. I avoided absolutely everything, so this experience for me was so great. I look forward to hearing what you reaction was to it and I cannot wait to see what happens in the rest of these episodes. The character that I'm referencing that you don't know what I'm talking about unless you do know what I'm talking about has made me cry every single episode. This character is extremely cute. That is all I'm gonna say because I don't wanna give anything away. But oh geez, it's amazing, it's so great. This is kinda my first impressions. I guess it's not really first impressions since I've watched hours and hours of content at this point. And this could not be a more perfect streaming platform for people who are fans of Disney and Pixar and Star Wars and Marvel. It has everything that we love. Disney+ is offering people a seven day free trial, so I've put a link in the description if you wanna check it out. I'm gonna go watch the latest Encore. See ya later.
